definition: in a short while/all at once/all of a sudden
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Don't eat up at one and you can have it after a while.
sentences.chinese: 别一下子全吃了，留一点过会儿再吃。

sentences.english: The arrow with Hydra’s blood shot through Nemean’s heart.
sentences.chinese: 那浸着许的毒血的箭一下子射进了阿尼破碎的心。

sentences.english: That he's not going to suddenly be left adrift.
sentences.chinese: 他不会突然一下子被抛弃。
突然，气氛一下子僵住了。

sentences.english: The gunshot started three birds at one time.
sentences.chinese: 枪声一下子把三只鸟给惊飞了。

sentences.english: A change came over Cronshaw's placid round face.
sentences.chinese: 克朗肖的平静的圆脸一下子变了色。

sentences.english: Suddenly I do not know how to say.
sentences.chinese: 一下子不知道从何说起。

sentences.english: Suddenly it all comes down, all at once.
He was sitting in front of me and I fell in love with the back of his neck.
sentences.chinese: 他就坐在我的前面，我一下子爱上了他脖子的背影。

sentences.english: Hearing the death of her son, Jennifer came apart at the seams.
sentences.chinese: 听到儿子的死讯，詹妮弗一下子神经失常了。

sentences.english: Touching something soft, I sprang quickly back.
sentences.chinese: 摸到一种软呼呼的东西，我一下子蹦了回来。

sentences.english: The ray in a twinkling gets black ugg tall seem period a meantime became night-time from the noon.
sentences.chinese: 光线瞬间变暗，好像时间一下子就从正午变成了半夜。

sentences.english: She performed a somersault with ease .
sentences.chinese: 她一下子就翻了一个跟头。

sentences.english: Heathcliff glanced at me a glance that kept me from interfering a moment.
sentences.chinese: 希刺克厉夫望了我一眼，这一眼使我一下子不能干预。

sentences.english: His bad mood of a moment earlier vanished completely, and he smiled at her.
sentences.chinese: 他刚刚的坏情绪一下子全消失了，朝她高兴地笑着。

sentences.english: Her heart jolted when she saw him.
sentences.chinese: 她看到他时心里咯噔一下子。

definition: original/originally/at first/it goes without saying/of course
at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
